content: I got this email today. Of course I voted the gibberish be removed from money as it hasn't been of much help. RT Will NBC be surprised??* Here's your chance to let the media know where the people stand on our faith in God, as a nation. NBC is presently taking a poll on "In God We Trust" to stay on our American currency. Please send this to every Christian atheist, agnostic, secularist, etc. (changes are mine, RT) you know so they can vote on this important subject. Please do it right away, before NBC takes this off their web page. Poll is still open so you can vote: This is not sent for discussion. If you agree forward it, if you don't, delete it. By my forwarding it, you know how I feel. I'll bet this is going to be a surprise to NBC. After you vote, you can see the results thus far. MOD HAT ON Hot link deleted. Reduce, you know better than that. This message has been edited. Last edited by: stillkit, Mon 02 March 2009 08:13 PM

content: These polls are worse than useless. They give people an idea that the whole country thinks one way or the other, but they're really packets of people of one persuasion or another being called to vote by their peers... or the same people voting multiple times. I know this for a fact because I've actually been able to influence numbers in polls myself over the years simply by passing the word to multiple newsgroups and other lists. There isn't an ounce of science in these things. They put them out there to draw people to their site, and nothing more.
